isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500, 8600 Models Built After 05/19/2003 - SERVICE CAB - SERVICE CAB - PARKING BRAKE

svcprocinfo.para: For Parking Brake see Figure 15, Figure 16, and Figure 17.

svcsubproc.title: Adjustment With The Brake Drum Removed

step1.para: Using calipers or a bore micrometer, measure the brake drum inside diameter.
Subtract 0.025 of an inch from the drum inside diameter. Set calipers or micrometer to this value.
Place calipers or micrometer around brake shoes (Figure 15) at center point of each shoe.

note.para: If the gage is not carefully placed at the center points of the shoes during adjustment the brakes may be over-adjusted and result in brake drag.

step1.para: Lift the brake shoe adjusting lever off of the brake shoe adjusting screw star wheel and rotate the brake adjusting screw star wheel until both shoes touch the calipers or micrometer.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Arrow Indicates Brake Adjusting Hole Plug

step1.para: Raise and support the vehicle rear axle so that the drive shaft rotates freely.
At the back of the brake backing plate ( Figure 16) remove the brake adjusting hole plug.
Using screwdriver move the brake shoe adjusting lever off the brake shoe adjusting screw star wheel.

note.para: The adjusting screw star wheel will have a paint mark on it that may be used as a reference point for this adjustment.

step1.para: Move the adjustment tool handle upward to lengthen the brake adjuster screw. Turn the brake shoe adjusting screw star wheel Figure 15, until the brake drum begins to drag. Then rotate the adjusting screw star wheel in the reverse direction one half revolution.
Replace the brake adjusting hole plug Figure 16.
